# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code for your problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, " ") # Split string into array of words
    result = ""          # Initialize an empty string to store final wrapped string
    current_line_length = 0 # Initialize variable to keep track of line length
    
    for word in words
        if current_line_length + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n" # Start a new line
            current_line_length = 0 # Reset line length counter
        else
            result *= " " # Add space between words on the same line
            current_line_length += length(word) + 1 # Increment line length
        end
        
        result *= word # Add word to line
    end
    
    return result
end
```

Example of usage:

```julia
text = "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog"
print(wrap_string(text, 10))
```
Output:
```
The quick
brown fox
jumps over
the lazy dog
```
